description: Blend of organism +â€Ž hormone, after German Orgon.

entries.meaning: In the psychoanalytic theory of Wilhelm Reich, a form of sexual energy or life force distributed throughout the universe and available for collection, storage, and further use. [from 20th c.]
examples: In the present report I shall describe the methods of quantitative measurement of the orgone by means of the electroscope and the thermometer.
